column5: Can someone tell me what causes Lac Seul's water to be stained? I have done searches on WC and also checked internet search engines and all I get is a lot of info about the fishing but no explanation for why the water is dark. Any info would be appeciated or if someone could direct me to where I can find out. thanks

[font color=green size=3][b]Wood, (downed trees)contain tanic acid or tanin which soaks out, staining the water. Generally how stained a lake in NWO is, has a relationship to wether it is a deep lake at the begining of the drainage system, or a shallow lake far down stream. It's like putting a tea bag in a 5 gal pail of water or 5 tea bags in a cup of water. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
Check out Silver water Wheel website. There is an article there that explains lac Seul and its conditions.
wood contributes to it but the greatest cause is the peat moss and tanic soil the runoff runs thru and the lake is sitting on
